title: Installation fails on python3.6 with .tar.gz package
body:
Since the creation of numpy 1.20.0rc1, it is impossible to install shap on a linux environment.
This is because the version of numpy is not set in the setup.py file. So if numpy is not found, pip installs the latest numpy which requires python>=3.7.

This makes shap installation not working on python 3.6 when no wheels are available.
A workaround is to install a previous version of numpy before installing shap.

Steps to reproduce:
- make sure to clean the pip cache
- create a new empty virtual env
- """ pip install -v shap ""

Expected Result:
Shap must be compiled and installed (from .tar.gz package)

Observed result:
`
Running setup.py (path:/tmp/pip-wheel-fh2iiiel/shap_8a7e7a78d4bf4aec86b2fa60bd274ee2/setup.py) egg_info for package shap
    Created temporary directory: /tmp/pip-pip-egg-info-fm5rvl3w
    Running command python setup.py egg_info
    Python version >= 3.7 required.
    WARNING: The C extension could not be compiled, sklearn tree models not supported.
    Searching for numpy
    Reading https://pypi.org/simple/numpy/
    Downloading https://files.pythonhosted.org/packages/81/46/ecc1ea3e5819eb0d83306a8f468693785c94ed5467fcbb6f2529abf0102f/numpy-1.20.0rc1.zip#sha256=98f4e754f1c3db7ca53e53b1ef6474703b167af75f3784f99b1fe4dd936ea77f
    Best match: numpy 1.20.0rc1
    Processing numpy-1.20.0rc1.zip
    Writing /tmp/easy_install-q_cshyza/numpy-1.20.0rc1/setup.cfg
    Running numpy-1.20.0rc1/setup.py -q bdist_egg --dist-dir /tmp/easy_install-q_cshyza/numpy-1.20.0rc1/egg-dist-tmp-6ipj6psy
    Python version >= 3.7 required.
    ERROR: Failed to build!
ERROR: No .egg-info directory found in /tmp/pip-pip-egg-info-fm5rvl3w
`
